snippet: The museum says the monographic show, which opens Nov. 20, will be the artist’s first major exhibition in the U.S. since a 1970s Guggenheim show.
abstract: Robin Pogrebin Inside Art column; Museum of Modern Art schedules major retrospective on eclectic artist Francis Picabia for June; May exhibit Promising Paradise: Cuban Allure, American Seduction at Wolfsonian in Miami will display pre-1959 tourism objects donated to institute by Atlantic City historian Vicki Gold Levi; J Greenstein & Co will auction Alan Dershowitz’s Judaica collection in March.
lead_paragraph: The museum says the monographic show, which opens Nov. 20, will be the artist’s first major exhibition in the U.S. since a 1970s Guggenheim show.

headline.print_headline: A Changing Artist Is Given His Due
headline.main: MoMA Plans a Fall Show Centered on Francis Picabia
